events.name: Manchester City at Brighton & Hove Albion

headlines.description: Manchester City retained the Premier League after surviving a scare on the final day to eventually see off Brighton and beat Liverpool to the title.
headlines.shortLinkText: Manchester City survive early scare to beat Liverpool to Premier League title on final day

headlines.description: Arsenal striker Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang scored a second-half brace to help the London club to a 3-1 victory at Burnley.
headlines.shortLinkText: Aubameyang double fires Arsenal to last-day win at Burnley

headlines.description: Crystal Palace ended their season in style on Sunday with a thrilling 5-3 triumph over Bournemouth at Selhurst Park.
headlines.shortLinkText: Palace end season with thrilling 5-3 win over Cherries

headlines.description: Already-relegated Fulham's season in the Premier League came to an end with a whimper after a 4-0 loss to Newcastle.
headlines.shortLinkText: Fulham thrashed by Newcastle on Prem final day

headlines.description: Chelsea were held to a 0-0 draw by Leicester City at King Power on Sunday, but the point was enough to secure third place in the Premier League.
headlines.shortLinkText: Chelsea held by Leicester but point enough for third place

headlines.description: Liverpool beat Wolves 2-0 on the final day but were denied a first league title since 1990 as Manchester City also won 4-1 against Brighton.
headlines.shortLinkText: Liverpool beat Wolves but miss out on Premier League title

headlines.description: Manchester United ended their Premier League campaign with a 2-0 home defeat by relegated Cardiff City to finish sixth in the table.
headlines.shortLinkText: Woeful Man United end season with Cardiff loss

headlines.description: Southampton and relegated Huddersfield Town battled to a 1-1 draw on the last day of the Premier League season on Sunday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Saints and Huddersfield share spoils in season-ender

headlines.description: Tottenham clinched fourth spot in the Premier League with a 2-2 draw at home to Everton on Sunday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Tottenham draw 2-2 with Everton to finish fourth

headlines.description: West Ham captain Mark Noble netted a goal in each half as West Ham beat Watford 4-1 on the final day of the Premier League season.
headlines.shortLinkText: Noble brace powers West Ham to win over Watford
